author: Staff Reporter
text:
Cell set up at Collectorate to keep watch on poll-related news

UNDER WATCHFUL EYES:District Election Officer and Collector M. Ravikumar inaugurating the media certification and monitoring cell at Thoothukudi Collectorate on Saturday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

A media certification and monitoring committee has been established by the district administration.

To keep watch on poll-related news and features appearing in print and electronic media ahead of the May 16 Assembly election, a media monitoring cell was inaugurated by District Election Officer and Collector M. Ravikumar here on Saturday in the presence of District Revenue Officer S. Murugaiah and Thoothukudi Sub-Collector S. Gopala Sundara Raj.

The committee would be responsible for certification of advertisements, monitoring of news in print and electronic media and keeping records of all election-related news of candidates in the fray.

This facility would help monitor whether poll-related expenditure incurred by the candidates were properly accounted for, Mr. Ravikumar said.

The committee, headed by the District Election Officer, comprised four other members. The committee members would verify the advertising contents sought to be published by political parties, the candidates or their supporters before releasing them to the media. Any violation of the model code of conduct by political parties would also be monitored.

The monitoring cell was equipped with five television sets, computers and recording equipment to analyse election news coverage round the clock. The committee members would monitor news channels and take cognisance of any code violations reported by the media, he added.
title: Media monitoring committee inaugurated
